Reviews.Title: “Confortable bed with soft pillows”
Reviews.Author: JingChaperot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the city centre, althought the lift is very small, but the room looks very clean, the pillows are very soft and confortable, and the staff are very nice. I left one shirt in the hotel, and the staff said they would send the package to me. I feel very warm. I think we will defenitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Horrible! and FEAR...”
Reviews.Author: AhKing
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located nearby to Strasbourg Saint-Denis Metro Station. Walking distance. Hotel location is not really centre of town. No shopping mall, mainly commercial building. Only few restaurants and cafeterias nearby, one supermart within vicinity, and few retails shop nearby the hotel. Hotel lobby is small. The lift is even smaller which can only occupied max 2 persons with bags. Rooms are rather small and depends on what type of room you book. A real low-budget hotel and definitely a 'cheapskate' one. I personally do not recommend this hotel to you, not even if you are a backpacker, whereby you can see drugs dealer making businesses, prostitution around, beggars on street and hanky-panky massages centre. You'll get sleepless nights due to loud noises from fighting, screaming voices and cars speeding and passersby on the street (which can be loudly heard through closed windows). This is the worst experience I had and seen in all my trips... Only one receptionist on-duty (an Indian fellow - front bald head), No smiling face, moody and mood swing. I witness with my own eyes, he shouted loudly to every guest for key drop each time the guests out from the hotel, scolded the guests for making the floor dirty, showing angry faces to the guests for picking up extra copies of brochures placed on the lobby shelf and etc. Such a bad attitude staff. Why the hotel employer employed such a staff to work in the hotel with bad atititude towards the guests? Fire him!!! I never thought this would happens to me too, after seeing the guests been harrassed in such ways. I asked for late check-out for only 10-mins, he shouted and scolded me, "No! cannot! You have to GET OUT early! If you late GET-OUT and I'll charged you 1-day room rate". I am a guest of the hotel and I paid. Guests don't deserve this type of BAD service.... I've been travelling around the world, visiting so many places, I have not encounter such bad and worst low class budget hotel in all my trip. If you were me, will you want to stay in such hotel? Don't stay in anymore..... WORST....

Reviews.Title: “Small clean room.”
Reviews.Author: JanStenberg
Reviews.Content: Very small room, but clean. Good location, 100 m to the Metro with three lines, makes it easy to reach most of Paris. The neighbourhood is a bit rough, but safe, I've been out late nights, there are lots of people out but I have never seen any problems special for this area. I prefer a surrounding with people and restaurants to some empty dull area. This is what I expect to get for €90 a night, and I will not mind staying at the same place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: MarceloSales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete nightmare. Despite it's location close to a metro station, at night you'll see a lot of gangs, drug dealers, and all sort of dangerous things for your life and pocket. The building itself is small, with rooms furnished with François Miterrand furniture. And all the furniture has a green paint to obscure your vision to details. The linens and sheets stinky to cigarrete and cigar. The carpet floor also. The bathroom has a huge step between the shower and the floor. If you have some kind of walk difficult or is handicapped, never stay at this place. Beyond all above things, you'll never could get to your room. The lift is a complete joke. How someone said before, it you fit only for a couple (without the luggage) in a complete insulation one in another. The staff has only one guy who is very kind, but the vast majority of the employees are like a wall. They will not even put the telephone aside for answer or talk to you. And remember, as you are not french (or does not speak french), prepare yourself to be almost raped, humiliated and mistreated by locals. They hate tourists. Beware, that paris of postcard has gone long ago.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst in town”
Reviews.Author: Pedro D
Reviews.Content: We arrived and checked in, as we saw the room we decided to leave, they cheraged us 2 nights instead of one night as described in the voucher booked direct in their website, so they were not fair enough to even garantee what their own website says, I tried to revert and get this one night back in the credit card but no answer was given to us, I feel that I was stolen by this hotel, very simple and with a website that do not retract the trully about their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Horror show”
Reviews.Author: Diego M
Reviews.Content: Terrible. Do NOT stay at this hotel. The rooms feel lived in, the service is atrocious and the location is not the best. It may be close to Marais, the Metro and there's a Velib across the street. But at night, like in MJ's 'Thriller', zombies, hookers and sketchy people come out to play and it can be quite depressing. The rooms leave a lot to desire. They are small (which is expected) and feel old and improperly cleaned. In good old European style, the shower doesn't have a curtain, so you have the choice of bathing sitting down or of making a swamp out of the whole bathroom. The people at front desk are not welcoming or helpful at all. But the cherry on top is definitely the housekeeping. We were fortunate enough to have a room adjacent to the laundry room. Every morning we would be woken up by laundry machine doors slamming, housekeeping staff yelling, laughing, stomping up and down the stairs, etc. It sounded like a construction site outside our room. As a result, of the week we stayed there, we didn't get a single descent night's sleep. Reporting this to front desk was as helpful as praying for a change. There are thousands of hotels in Paris. Don't stay at this one.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value for a good location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Asitawata
Reviews.Content: The location is great, we could step out and walk right into a variety of restaurants or catch the metro. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The hotel was pretty , a bit shabby really, super tiny elevator. The room clean, was spacious. The beds, bathroom, air-conditioning, and other amenities were good. We liked the separate reading lights for each bed. Breakfast although there was not a huge choice, was fresh and unlimited French bread, croissants, yoghurt's, fruit, cheese, sliced meats, jam, cereals and boiled eggs and drinks. Absolutely great value for money

Reviews.Title: “pretents to be a 3 stars, would be rather affordable for that category, is however a 2 stars at best”
Reviews.Author: nomadys
Reviews.Content: Once more in Paris, once more another hotel. Chose that one mainly because of many good rewiews, which I can't quite understand. At â‚¬ 124.-- I chose a double room to have more space, but it wasn't worth it: the room is tiny and the very, very used green painted furniture comes straight out of the seventies. Hell, they even had a similar chair in my room as i bought in 1977 (and thruw away ca. 1987). Walls are yellow, and the hotel has for me about the charm of a Russian clinic. Well, at least everything you would expect is there, and I don't complain at all about the cleanliness, but it's the sum of details which don't make this stay pleasant: room too hot, too small, they want to charge a whopping â‚¬ 24.-- (!) for a day of Wifi, thin walls so that you constantly hear neighbours. The good things: a bit off the main street so that it's relatively quiet, Metro station Strasbourg St. Denis is only 2 minutes away. Don't know yet how the breakfast will be, i hope to sleep well, as the matresses are at least not bad, anf the sheets smell fresh. Nevertheless I've been in much nicer hotels in Paris at the same or lower price, and many 2-stars beat this one overall.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places, but not that bad”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Stayed the end of Sept 2011 for 3 days. 2 couples in a quad room. The hotel was a short 15 min walk from the West train station and we thought it was easy to find. We arrived early - 1 pm and the young Asian lady (sorry, I lost her name....) was very helpful and friendly spoke perfect english. We unexpectantly got right into the room. It was small, but clean. The bathroom was huge - 2 sinks and tub with a shower - however no shower curtain or any indication there ever was one. We were on the 4th floor - the elevator is old, small and slow and all we did was send the luggage up. The stairs are winding and a bit in disrepair. The room did have a small, ineffective AC unit and it was unseasonably warm - in the upper 70s - we wound up just sleeping with the windows open. There is a fair amount of traffic noise, but not something a cheap pair of foam earplugs didn't handle. The metro station was a block away and there was several cafe's and a grocery store that was opened fairly late which was convenient. We didn't see any hookers on the street, only one homeless guy who had set up a nice little cardboard apartment near the metro - he wasn't bothering anyone that we could see. Other than walking from the train station to the hotel and the hotel to the metro station/grocery we didn't do any walking around that area. Most of the sites were about a 15 min metro ride - and we did come back fairly late a couple of nights and didn't feel unsafe. As mentioned in other posts - the night desk clerk was absolutely useless - our TV remote was not in room and we didn't realize it until around 10 pm when we got back the first night - he insisted we did have one - so I just went downstairs and took his while he wasn't looking - so in the end I guess he was right. We didn't have a problem getting in after the doors were locked. The maid service was good - the room was made up and fresh towels every day. No indication that any of our belongings had been looked over. So all things considering it is what it is, in an expensive city it was an average room - I think they charge too much for what you are getting ,but this is Paris after all and everything is expensive. Would I stay here again, who knows - would depend on what I could find elsewhere, this was a last minute trip. If the metro was any further away then you would want to avoid this property. I waited to post this until the credit card charges had cleared - like others had mentioned we did not get a receipt when we checked out - it was the worthless night desk clerk as we had an early flight out. He stated I would get it in and email - that never happened. But no surprise charges. The hotel was booked through American Express.

Reviews.Title: “Gross and unsafe”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy177
Reviews.Content: I wanted to leave as soon as I walked in. Not only is the decor old and shabby, but it generally felt unsafe. With hookers on the streets outside AND in the next room, I don't know how I lasted three nights. The shower was mouldy and the towels dingy and gray. Yes they're is air conditioning, but right over the bed. The Asian woman at the front desk was the only decent source of service. Close to the subway, but so are much better hotels for the same price or better. It definitely made me not like Paris as much.

Reviews.Title: “It was awful!!”
Reviews.Author: Arminkh
Reviews.Content: We had a trip to this hotel last summer an it was awful! rooms were dirty and untidy and staff had a bad behavior and the location was disappointing full of criminals the only thing was that it was near the metro station!

Reviews.Title: “Really fantastic service...they posted my dresses back to me!”
Reviews.Author: asw27
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, comfotable, friendly and welcoming and situatied in a nice area with many restaurants and bars. Having just checked in at the airport to come home, I realised I had left two of my favourite dresses in the wardrobe of the room. I rang the hotel and explained the situation and one of the receptionists (Muriel) was extremely helpful: she foud the dresses for me and put them in the post immediately . I offered to pay for the postage but was informed that this was a service they are happy to provide for their guests. I would strongly recomment this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, & Affordale”
Reviews.Author: MsBadRas
Reviews.Content: I actually found this hotel through Amex Travel. Initially after reading the reviews I had mixed feelings. If you are big on hotels and luxurious amenities this isn't necessarily the place for you. Most likely if you are in Paris you are going to be spending the majority of your time out of the hotel so the Hotel du Plat d'Etain will be just perfect. The front desk staff was friendly and the hotel room was very clean. My only complaint was the room was very small, but the cleanliness was a huge selling point for me. I was literally only there for sleep and showers so this was great. There is a tv in the room and the internet service was 4â‚¬ for 24 hours. I stayed in room 105 which had a double bed, a shower, and a view of a side street. The hotel was in a nice quite area and very close the the Strasbourg-Saint-Denis, Temple, and RÃ©publique metro stations. I would stay there again if visiting this area of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great for around town”
Reviews.Author: felipe72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a quiet area of â€‹â€‹Paris, about 100 meters from the subway station Strasbourg-Paris St. Denis, served by three lines with 4, 8 and 9. In about 15 minutes to reach all the strategic places for sightseeing. The hotel is not new but is well kept, and cleanliness is excellent. Our triple room was large and the bathroom was almost another room. The elevator is a bit 'small and not very convenient as the stairs are very comfortable, but unless you have serious physical problems or claustrophobia, are both available without problems. the staff is very courteous and willing to answer any questions with kindness. For the price and location, I think it's a really good compromise for those who need a starting point for exploring the city. would not recommend it for those who love the hotel life. breakfast, we can not judge because we have always used the best bakery and the wonderful bars that are 20 meters from the hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: usasu
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!!! you would be much better off in a hostel seriously. The hotel is located in a street no one has ever heard of so it was pretty difficult to get to. The hotel itself is not bad but the night staff is horrible, if you get there after midnight they donâ€™t like to open the door they just stare at you and ignore you for a couple of minutes. One night my roommate and I forgot our key in the room when we asked him if he could please let us into our room he said â€œwe donâ€™t have spare keys the only thing we can do is rent you another room but we are full tonightâ€� this was obviously a lie since A. itâ€™s a hotel and B. housekeeping gets in everyday. He was very rude and finally after a couple of minutes he told us he could get is in with a very bad attitude. Food was decent and morning staff where much better it is well located but I would not recommend this hotel! Trust me you can do much better in Paris. WIFI is NOT FREE its 4 euros

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff, but rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Europe39
Reviews.Content: We had a pleasant stay. Very close to everything. Super tiny elevator bordering on claustrophobic. We didn't do the breakfast package, since you could get breakfast for less at the many cafe's nearby. The rooms were on the frumpy side with peeling paint, and outdated furniture. We did have a hairdryer but no iron. We left a tip for the maid along with a note (in french), yet she never accepted it--weird. If all you want is a place to sleep, stay here. I would.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: kameswara23
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and very helpful. They helped us even though we were too early to check-in. The room was spacious and great for four people. The beds, bathroom, air-conditioning, and other amenities were great and definitely 3 - 4 stars. We liked the separate reading lights for each bed. Every night we spent there was restful. The location is great, we could step out and walk right into a variety of restaurants or catch the metro. We will definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has bad service, and its honestly not worth 3 stars....dont pay for this”
Reviews.Author: neetasingh
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel, and we figured that a 3 star hotel really wouldnt be that bad. When we got there, it was pretty good. The guy at the front desk was the owner and he really helped us out in getting around. We came back later that night, and there was a guy at the front desk. He gave us our keys, and we went upstairs. As soon as we entered the room, we realized that it was burning hot! We tried to adjust the air conditioner, but then we realized it was broken. We called the front desk as it was unbearably hot, but the guy told us that he was the only one at the front desk so there wasnt anything he could do. He told us to open the windows. But when we opened the curtain, we saw homeless people outside our window!!! We refused to open the window because it obviously wasnt safe! The kids were unable to sleep, so we called him again and asked if he could atleast move us to a different room. He could not even do that for us. We were so disappointed and it was terrible inside that room, so we decided to switch hotels the next day itself. That night, we bought internet access and booked a room in another hotel...it was last minute, so it cost us a fortune, but we had no other option.When we called the front desk to tell him we were checking out, he fought with us for a half hour. We couldnt sleep that night because of the terrible heat... Not only did we have this problem, but we had other problems too... there was no shower curtain in the bathroom, so anytime we took a shower, all the water would fall out. It was pretty bad. The towels were stained, and it was really gross. They were stained brown and black...it was just really disgusting. The next morning, when we were checking out, they charged us for two nights, even though we only stayed for one...we were really pissed off. When we complained, they said they couldnt do anything about it... The location is not good, its located in a ghetto, and like i said before, there were homeless people sleeping outside our window...it was scary. I would not recommend staying at this hotel...I'm gonna dispute the charges, but dont even waste your time on this, because its really not worth the 3 stars it has. I'd probably give it 1 star...really bad hotel experience..

Reviews.Title: “super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thirstytravellers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in April 2010. The hotel was pretty "no frills", a bit shabby really. Our room was at the front of the hotel so it was pretty noisy at night. It was an awesome location though, close to shopping, cafes etc. Also the staff were all super friendly and helpful. Pretty good value for a good location in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will return”
Reviews.Author: lisachester
Reviews.Content: Excellent Value for Money. I stayed last two days of Feb 2010 with 7 year old daughter. Staff were very friendly, and helpful, though lift was tiny, the room was very clean, well equipped and everything worked. We had a high, quiet, nice and warm room, with a comfy bed so a good nights sleep was no problem, which given there was a huge storm with high winds was excellent. The bathroom was spotless, and plenty of fluffy towels, changed daily. Great location - 15 min walk to George Pompidou centre, Strasbourg St Denis metro less than 5 mins walk away, which is two stops from Gard De Nord, and about 3 from Les Halles. We could get to everywhere very easily. Breakfast was 10 euros, it was all you could eat, and although there was not a huge choice, was fresh and unlimited (French bread, croissants, yoghurt's, fruit, cheese, sliced meats, jam, cereals and boiled eggs and drinks), children ate free. I cannot stress again how helpful the staff were - all spoke English and one even went so far as to take me outside and take me to the junction to point out a family friendly restaurant. It may be basic , dÃ©cor may be a little tired (yellow painted textured paper)- but it was very clean, and comfy, I will definitely stay there again. To top it off I was able to leave our bags there on the last day whilst we went site seeing prior to going to Eurostar - free of charge. Nice area too, shops, cafes and bars, a theatre, all sorts nearby. Absolutely great value for money. Good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Susie78
Reviews.Content: Very ugly and tired decor . Very noisy outside the room early in the morning - presumably the cleaners had their equipment on this floor. Would not stay here again. Admittedly it was cheap but I would rather pay more and stay in a nicer room.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Please don't stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: GideonN
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start. From the rude front desk personnel to the loud bulling cleaning ladies. This was my worst hotel experience in my life. As a single guy traveling thru Europe I was very disappointed to learn that you are NOT allowed to bring "visitors" to your room after midnight. You have to leave you room key at the front desk when you leave the hotel and if you come in after midnight the hotel is closed, you have to ring a bell and wait for the receptionist to wake up and open the side door for you. He is not very happy to be awaken. One night he was in long underwear as he opened the side door, I almost gagged! Location is not the best either the neighborhood is a getho. If you plan to sleep after 9am, forget it! The cleaning ladies start banging (not knocking) on doors and it doesn't matter if you have the "do not disturb" tag on the door, they will still bang on your door and bully you into leaving so that they can clean. If you refuse and go back to bed, the phone will ring asking if you want service; I said no twice before! The internet doesn't work half the time, and no, it's not free. I stayed here for a week and honestly my Paris experience was greatly diminished thanks to this crappy hotel and service. Please don't stay here! You can do much better in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, pleasant staff, clean rooms I recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: chippy098
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful, rooms small but clean and warm. It is in a very convenient spot for the metro, cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, not a bad hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mrsdwf
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here after booking this hotel and have to say i was absolutely dreading it. We were travelling with our 1 year old daughter. It was fine! Its a quiet hotel. Yes, the rooms aren't that big but they're clean and we managed to get a travel cot in. They have air conditioning (which was great, even if the bed was underneath). The bathroom was immaculate with clean towels every day. Water was hot, didn't matter what time we had a shower. When we arrived,they had put a bed in for our daughter though i had requested a cot and they had it changed within the hour. The beds were made up every day. Its a perfect location for the metro, its literally round the corner and we walked to the Gare De Nord with luggage and baby and that was fine. We found the staff pleasant enough, if we needed hot water for the baby, we got it and we asked for microwave access to heat food up for her and we got that. The room could have been doing with a kettle, that would have made it a bit easier for us. The tv in the room didn't pick up any british channels but hey!! We were in Paris, we weren't there to watch tv!! The local area isn't great, we did come across about a dozen hookers within the first 15 minutes of walking but they didn't bother us. There's a supermarket across the road and eating places around the corner. We didn't take the hotel breakfast, felt the 10 euros for a continental breakfast was a bit steep so got coffee and croissants at a cafe across the road for two, much cheaper. So all in all, the hotel did what it was meant to do for us - somewhere to sleep. We didn't go to Paris expecting 5 star luxury, really felt we got what we paid for and that was fine for us. Who goes to Paris to stay in a hotel room anyway?!! Oh, the lift is an experience!! Never been in a lift so small in my life! Took us 4 trips to get everything upstairs when we arrived and we were on the 5th floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Hotel with bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: beatentrack
Reviews.Content: I have visited a number of hotels in Paris but this one is definitely the worst. We paid Â£250 for two nights in a double via an online provider which had good reviews for the Hotel. However, when we asked for something as basic as a second bed sheet we had to negotiate for it and convince the gentleman at reception that we really needed it. The service was rude and unfriendly - one had this general feeling of not trusting anyone at the Hotel and we were waiting to be screwed any minute... The bad treatment culminated in us asking for a cab at reception and when it was ordered and we wanted to wait for it outside we were ordered (not kindly asked) to stay in the reception area. When we nonetheless left the reception area we were shouted at "do not take another cab now as we will get charged for this one!". There was no "please" or any other form of politeness but by that time we did not expect any of it anyway. The room was very small (but that is a common feature in Paris and no reason to dismiss a Parisian Hotel) and did not really have a clean feel to it although I have seen more dirty places. The furniture was cheap, old and a bit too colourful for the tasteful eye. Also, our bed was clearly only laid out for one person as it was not accessible from the other side and only had one bedside table. Funnily enough the bathroom had quite good size and felt quite spacious. The location is very central and access to the Grand Boulevard is easy. Of course the more one moves west on the Boulevard the better the area gets but you also pay more in the restaurants and bars and therefore we did not mind being in an a little bit less upmarket area which had its own charme. Paris has a lot of three star hotels on offer (even in this area) and you should check carefully where you are booking, this one is a definite "don't go there" from me!

Reviews.Title: “Definately not a 3 star quality hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: travellingtrini
Reviews.Content: 3 rooms in 5 nights! The first room had a clogged shower, we had to stop bathing and switch off the water halfway through to allow the water to drain and then continue. One of the front desk clerks was extremely rude (was sleeping in sweat pants and old T-shirt on a mattress with sheets and a pillow behind the front desk the first night we came in and was most upset that we woke him up to let us in the hotel), when we asked him to change rooms the first time he was giving me attitude and telling me that I was being rude to him and then blatantly ignoring us after a while, talking on his cell phone and refusing to address our issue of an unusable shower. Second room had a single bed when we specifically asked for a double and the third room we got moved to, the phone did not work. I felt like a nomad and very unsettled, our luggage spent more time in the baggage room than our room because we were moved so many times. We also had to sleep with the windows open, enduring the noise from the street below because the AC is set for heat and there's no way to adjust the temperature. It was definitely one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Lucyfoxx
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel after 6 hours of travelling, and at least an hour of walking around lugging our suitcases. We were exhausted. We arrived at the front desk, the very rude man on reception told us that we didn't have a room, and that we had been booked into a hotel about 15 min walk away. He didn't apologise, or offer to get us a cab at the hotel's expense. He just pointed it out on the map, and told us to go. We said this wasn't acceptable. We had booked a room at this hotel (through lastminute) and we wanted to stay we were. We certainly didn't feel like dragging our bags across Paris for another 15 mins, we were about to collapse. We tried to be polite at first. Surely there was something they could do? No. no. Then he started yelling at us and being very rude. This is a nicer hotel we have booked you into. Go there. Umm, could he not offer to get us a cab? Could he not at least apologise, offer to get us a cup of tea while we rested, and at least be polite and helpful?! No he screamed at us, as if it were our fault the hotel had double booked! While we were having this argument, another hotel guest came down to complain that the light in their room didn't work. In the 30 mins we were at this desk he made no attempt to do anything about it. After about 10 mins of being yelled at, but refusing to take it lying down, he offered for a plain clothed, dodge looking guy in reception to walk us to the other hotel. In the dark backstreets of Paris?? I don't think so, we said. He yelled at us again. Eventually, he left his plain clothed mate at the desk and walked us himself. He didn't offer us any help with our bags. When we got to the other hotel (which was thankfully lovely) he said "You see, too close for a taxi". Something he could have explained to us in the beginning!!! The moral of this story. Never ever stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: rivke
Reviews.Content: We were tossing up between Holiday Inn Republique and Plat d'Etain as they were closely matched in price but chose Plat dâ€™Etain as it was more of an authentic Paris hotel. What a disaster! We didnâ€™t arrive in Paris till 11pm so when we got there we were tired and ready to crash. The man on reception didnâ€™t tell us anything about the hotel and its facilities he only said that the lift was broken and had been for the last 2 weeks. He then told us we were on the 3rd floor and we had to lug our suitcases up the stairs ourselves while he sat and watched with a smile on his face. The stairs, mind you, are coming off the wall and I almost wondered if I was going to break the stairs completely with my heavy suitcase. Our room was all the way round the backend and the hallways were so dark we couldnâ€™t even see the light switches which made them redundant. Our room was a dump, the bed spreads werenâ€™t clean and they had cigarette burns in them. Over all it was very very dodgey hotel and for 2 30 year old woman, quite scary. We decided against breakfast as the service so far was crap and we only imagine how bad it would be. The next morning we went out all day and came back to the hotel at about 5pm to get ready to go to Moulin Rouge. We needed to iron out dresses and went down to ask reception where our iron was kept as we couldnâ€™t find it. He informed us that they had facilities that the pressing room is closed its only open between 10am and 4pm or something like that, and that it was basically too bad, I will state that all he had to do was walk up one flight of stairs and open the door for us, he wouldnâ€™t as using the iron outside of the pressing room hours is against policy, mind you when I say pressing room itâ€™s a big cupboard with a washer and dryer and an iron and like a wood bench with a towel on it as an ironing board. We had to cancel our tickets to the Moulin Rouge as we literally had nothing to wear that didnâ€™t require ironing other than our PJâ€™s. After a huge row with the manager about the poor service and that how can he charge 153 Euro a night when there is no lift and no iron is appalling. I said the hotel is nothing like what they show and state on their website and that they are scammers and that we want to leave. He said he would give us a 40% discount but after I argued some more, manage to get out of paying for that night even though it was like 6pm and he wouldnâ€™t be able to fill the room. Itâ€™s hard to convey in short words and without pictures what a poor quality hotel this place is but I implore you, for 20 Euro more you could stay in the gorgeous Holiday Inn Republique which is only like 3 minutes away. This hotel is way over priced for its service and amenities. Recommend you never ever stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan_T79
Reviews.Content: The hotel was basic but the rooms were clean and staff were helpful. The best thing about it was how close it was to the metro and the centre of Paris. Would definatley stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: GabiK
Reviews.Content: I have choosed this hotel from Internet and it was the worst experience for me. Small rooms, old furniture, poor breakfast. These are things I can't accept. The only good thing is that is close to the center (G. Pompidou), but in Paris doesn't matter, the subway metro is going perfectly. And another point is that on the e-mail correspondence it was told us the child under 10 years is for free, but in the end we had to pay the breakfast for her, at normal rate 9 EUR/day. My advice is when you have to book accomodation in Paris, is better to ask a travel agent to do it. Might be a little bit expensive at the first glance, but better than sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel - for other reasons than aleady given”
Reviews.Author: relj
Reviews.Content: Given the rail strike and the massive disruption in Paris, I had to cancel my trip. The hotel refused to refund my deposit which I thought was petty and unconscionable in that it held foreigners to account for their local political struggles. I wouldn't give them any more business.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and Dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Cloudboy
Reviews.Content: This has to be some kind of scam. It looks nothing like the pictures. I got to the hotel, the receptionist took my credit card, but refused to give me a receipt OR to give me anything to sign. He gave me my key, but told me I had to leave it at the front desk whenever I left my room. I got up to the room, and after going down these twisty, stair-filled hallways, got to a room in which the ashtrays were filled with cigarette buts. I hiked back down and got another room to try. This one had empty ashtrays, but the furniture was falling apart. While the bathroom did have a shower in it, I would probably not dare use it. I ended up leaving and staying in the Holiday Inn down the street. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: HairyFrank
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute dash to Paris for 2 nights....booked 48hrs via hotel website. Great location. A busy yet cosmopolitan area in the 3rd with plenty of local shops (in fact a whole street of shoe shops), bars and restaurants. The metro is less than 2 mins walk away. It's typically Parisean but just off the main street making it quieter. It is a clean hotel with good facilities like air con, LCD TV, mini bar. Yes agree decor is dated but my partner seemed to like it! Staff are nice and most speak English. Dan on front desk is very helpful. Did not try the breakfast as there are so many nice places to eat round there! We are going back here in 10 years.......

Reviews.Title: “efficient service and pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: BristolPolymnia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at this hotel in June 2007. I was really impressed by the professionalism and friendliness of the staff. Because of overbooking, they have arranged for me to stay in a nearby hotel at their expense although that hotel was more expensive. They have even volunteered to take me to the new hotel which was less than 50m away. As for the hotel, it may look a bit dated but it is clean, has all the amenities, the location is excellent and the price is very good. Overall, it is very good value for money and service is excellent Nicholas UK

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place at great location”
Reviews.Author: waterturtle
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean rooms, with lcd television. Absolutely great location, very close to the metro and to the Latin Quater. Very recommend to others and will certanly stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Plat d'Etain
HotelInfo.Address: 69, rue Meslay | 3rd Arr., 75003 Paris, France
